name: Gone With The Wind (A Hurricane Quiz) | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: In 1954 this hurricane hit the Northeastern United States?
What southern state was affected by Hurricane Carla in 1961?
questions.explanation:
Texas.

	Carla hit Texas from September 11th to September 14th 1961, causing widespread damage.

questions.text: Hurricane Audrey was particularly severe, hitting Louisiana and Northern Texas. In what year did Audrey strike?
questions.explanation:
1957.

	Audrey blasted states from Texas to Alabama for five days, leaving 390 fatalities in its wake.

questions.text: In what month of 1965 did Hurricane Betsy strike?
questions.explanation:
September.

	Hurricane Betsy hit September 7th through September 12th 1965.

questions.text: In 1969 another severe hurricane struck the south, what was it called?
questions.explanation:
Camille.

	Camille hit Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama in August of that year.

questions.text: Hurricane Agnes struck a huge portion of the east coast, from Florida to New York. In what year?
questions.explanation:
1972.

	Agnes hit from June 19th through June 29th of that year.

questions.text: In 1979 a hurricane that hit Florida and the Eastern United States, as well as the Caribbean, left a very high fatality list. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
David.

	From August 30th to September 7th, 1979, Hurricane David caused massive destruction and cost 1,100 lives.

questions.text: In what year did Hurricane Gloria strike?
questions.explanation:
1985.

	Gloria hit North Carolina and the Northeastern United States.

questions.text: In 1989 this hurricane struck South Carolina and parts of the Caribbean. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
Hugo.

	Hugo struck September 16th through September 22nd.

questions.text: Hurricane Andrew was the costliest natural disaster in U.S. history, at the time it hit. In what year did Andrew cause so much damage?
questions.explanation:
1992.

	Although Andrew didn't leave a very high death toll, it left 200,000 people homeless and caused 15.5 billion dollars worth of damage.
